lines.text:
[to Vallier]
I shall be reborn. My breath in the heavens, bear witness. We shall be free. We'll we be loved. If you do truly love me, let your love be known unto me.
We must all take our leave of each other eventually. It is Nature's law...Don't cry.
a state of the mind and a state of the soul.
I'd even let you... spoil my vacation.
They say a French woman is coming into town, flying in a marvelous red balloon.
The kind one sees in ones dreams?
No, Vallier, the kind one sees in Paris.
Love is the worst lie one can tell oneself.
The confession will take place in the chapel.
[Older Simon grabs Bishop Bilodeau by the back of the neck and holds a knife to his throat.]

[Hands knife to Bishop]
Never, Bilodeau, never.
